results.title: Les Voyages de Marco Polo
results.brief_description:
Episode 12 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
This episode covers the expansion of the Mongol Empire with Gengis Khan and then his grand son, Kublai Khan. Niccolo and Maffeo Polo, two Venitian merchants reach the court of the Great Khan. When they return to Europe as Kublai’s ambassadors to the pope, they are charged with letters asking the pope to send Kublai one hundred intelligent men ‘acquainted with the Seven Arts’. They are asked to bring back some oil from the lamp burning at the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem. On their second journey, they take along their nephew Marco who was to stay at the Khan’s court for 20 years and recount his adventure in a book ‘Il Milione’.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Le Siecle des Lumieres = the Age of Reason
results.brief_description:
Episode 20 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
This European intellectual movement of the 17th and 18th centuries in which ideas concerning God, reason, nature, and man were synthesized into a worldview that gained wide assent and that instigated revolutionary developments in art, philosophy, and politics. Central to Enlightenment thought were the use and the celebration of reason, the power by which man understands the universe and improves his own condition. The goals of rational man were considered to be knowledge, freedom, and happiness. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Le Quattrocento
results.brief_description:
Episode 14 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
The Quattrocento was a period of prosperity and steady progression in the arts toward the harmonious balance achieved in the High Renaissance. In concrete terms, the Quattrocento is regarded as beginning in 1401 with a competition to design the eastern doors for the Baptistery in Florence and ending in 1503 with the election of Cardinal Giuliano della Rovere as Pope Julius II. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Tube and shape binding
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to form aluminium”.
Focuses on aluminium bending as an efficient means of fabrication, and describes the most common methods of bending.

results.title: La Revolution Francaise = the French Revolution
results.brief_description:
Episode 22 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
A fourty minute overview of the events spanning from the storming of La Bastille to the irresistible ascent of Bonaparte. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Blanking and piercing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to form aluminium”.
US Army Air Force training film. Shows step by stp factory demonstration of punch and die operations on aluminium blanks including the different methods of hand feeding and mechanical feeding.

results.title: La Belle Epoque
results.brief_description:
Episode 24 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
What is commonly know as La Belle Epoque covers the years from 1870 to 1914. It is a time of great progress, both intellectual and technical. This episode focuses of the advances in the automotive industry and railways. Other topics include: the colinzation of the African continent, the construction of the Metro in Paris and the cinematograph. The October Revolution in Russia and the beginning of the mobilization in 1914 are also mentionned.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Spinning
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to form aluminium”.
Training film covering the different spinning processes used in forming aluminium. Shows factory floor demonstration of shaping techniques step by step with a recap of essentials.
